title: Rescue teams continue searches in Mexico City
description:
(30 Sep 2017) Across Mexico City at sites where buildings and homes collapsed during the recent earthquake, people are showing their appreciation and respect for the efforts made by first responders and search teams.
At what is left of an office building in Colonia Roma Norte, the only site where rescue and recovery activity can be still be seen, residents hand out food to those who continue with the effort despite knowing that the chances of finding someone alive is so slim. 
The death toll from Mexico's magnitude 7.1 earthquake rose by two on Saturday and now stands at 360.
It includes 219 deaths in Mexico City, where 38 buildings collapsed during the temblor.
The rest of the casualties came in five states near the capital.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/12bb9598e86fa6b536555133f459a7c3 
Find out more about AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/HowWeWork
